snippet.textDisplay:
Only recently did I take this wonderful thing you guys created to heart and seriously watch through season 3 thanks to people like my friends, Kaggyfilms channel, etc. I am sorry, damn near in tears to see it stop after knowing just how long its taken you guys to get through all this, to work your asses off and do what you've done these past 12, 12 god damned years... You are both Legends, and I hope maybe one day you guys decide,"Fuck it, we've done alot of the things we love, and I miss making DBZA, should we finish it?" if and whrn it could happen. Nobody, nobody here knows the future and I don't want negative comments that just tells me that either, I don't.

But, even if you dont, I will cherish every dick kick, horse eating, ghost of nappa, teary eyed laughter and silly moment to the last of my tears running dry. Thank you TFS, for making my childhood a oddly memorable one, we'll all keep fighting on to show our love and support.. 💜

Nobody, nobody here knows the future and I don't want negative comments that just tells me that either, I don't.

But, even if you dont, I will cherish every dick kick, horse eating, ghost of nappa, teary eyed laughter and silly moment to the last of my tears running dry. Thank you TFS, for making my childhood a oddly memorable one, we'll all keep fighting on to show our love and support.. 💜

snippet.textDisplay:
I feel like I just got broken up with. Omg this is so sad. Guys, you’ve been around since the beginning, since LK (Martin) did this crazy thing called abridge... you’ve meant so much to all of us. Thank you for devoting so much of your time to this project. Let me tell you, it was well-worth it. I have so many good memories watching this series. Those memories, we’ve all made, will be irreplaceable to us. Burn out is a helluva thing though. Let us move forward to bigger and better things!

(Here’s hoping for an InuYasha Abridge.)
(Press X to Doubt.)

snippet.textDisplay:
Alright. Nick. Scott. Let me begin by saying yes, I am very disappointed. I have been a fan and contributor to your channel since the second season of DBZA, after my game master and friend showed me season one. Not seeing buu become a tfs reality is both frustrating and disheartening. I hope you both continue to read beyond this point as well. I knew this was coming. As soon as I saw how you ended episode 60, I saw how you could have seen this as the final entry into the franchise. Your skills as writers and content originators has been hampered and in many ways restrained by the medium of DBZA. There can be no doubt in my mind about that. While I cannot say I won’t miss my favorite voices for these characters moving forward, I do say that I completely understand your reasons. I do not see them as excuses nor do I hold you in contempt for them. The simple fact is, while I remember Chris Sabat as my favorite voices from dragon ball, it’s Nicks’ voice that I hear in my head. You guys have elevated the fan base and breathed further life into the franchise that would never have existed without you. I honestly feel that dragon ball super exists in small part to your series. It is because of how much fun you had with the source material that got so many more people talking about it again. You guys have made new and exciting characters out of a series that framed my childhood and sent me to my television every week after school for toonami, characters that will continue to exist in my mind long after episode 60 becomes a distant memory on the internet. You are going to lose subscribers, and receive a measure of heat for this. I, for one, will not be among them. I’m sticking with you guys. I want to see what comes next. You have my support and my fandom and that will not change.
You have delivered a mighty ki blast to my spirit on this day, guys, but like the series we love so much, when the dust settles I will still be standing here. With burning energy. Ready for what comes next.
Your Alaskan Viking fan. Charles Knefelkamp.

Ps. This doesn’t mean I don’t still wanna throw you at something just once. :)
snippet.textOriginal:
Alright. Nick. Scott. Let me begin by saying yes, I am very disappointed. I have been a fan and contributor to your channel since the second season of DBZA, after my game master and friend showed me season one. Not seeing buu become a tfs reality is both frustrating and disheartening. I hope you both continue to read beyond this point as well. I knew this was coming. As soon as I saw how you ended episode 60, I saw how you could have seen this as the final entry into the franchise. Your skills as writers and content originators has been hampered and in many ways restrained by the medium of DBZA. There can be no doubt in my mind about that. While I cannot say I won’t miss my favorite voices for these characters moving forward, I do say that I completely understand your reasons. I do not see them as excuses nor do I hold you in contempt for them. The simple fact is, while I remember Chris Sabat as my favorite voices from dragon ball, it’s Nicks’ voice that I hear in my head. You guys have elevated the fan base and breathed further life into the franchise that would never have existed without you. I honestly feel that dragon ball super exists in small part to your series. It is because of how much fun you had with the source material that got so many more people talking about it again. You guys have made new and exciting characters out of a series that framed my childhood and sent me to my television every week after school for toonami, characters that will continue to exist in my mind long after episode 60 becomes a distant memory on the internet.  You are going to lose subscribers, and receive a measure of heat for this.  I, for one, will not be among them. I’m sticking with you guys. I want to see what comes next. You have my support and my fandom and that will not change.  
You have delivered a mighty ki blast to my spirit on this day, guys, but like the series we love so much, when the dust settles I will still be standing here. With burning energy. Ready for what comes next. 
Your Alaskan Viking fan. Charles Knefelkamp.

Ps. This doesn’t mean I don’t still wanna throw you at something just once. :)

snippet.textDisplay: I got the chance to see the start of that abridged animation trend on Youtube for more than a decade (my first one was Berserk Abridged by hbi2k way back). I got the chance to view a lot of awesome parodies, to laugh at moments where there wasn't much to laugh about and to see how creative things getting polished more and more in time. TFS is one of the longest ones ever done and you deserve all the praise for doing so far as well as so many other projects. But as the years come and gone, Youtube changed and your lifes also changed. Hopefully, we will be able to hear about you guys and your future creations still.

Maybe you shouldn’t have hyped up a Season 4 if you guys were so against continuing it 🤷🏻‍♂️ literally your own worst enemies.

snippet.textDisplay:
DBZA is over because people decided to disregard the promise that was made and the years of support solely because of DBZA. A large majority of your subs will probably leave since this was the only reason most of us were here. For many it was the only reason to contribute to the Patreon for years just waiting for more episodes because we were told there would be more episodes. But I guess none of that matters.

Unsubbed. Bye.

snippet.textDisplay:
My day and probably my year is ruined, but i dont have nothing say but THANKS.


Thank you for all the jokes, the laughs, the trama and the personalities of the characters that felt so real and aunthentic despite this was a parody, a comedy.
I remember come home at night, really high and ready to sleep, but a notificacion of the second part of the cell fight was upload in my phone. I was waiting for months that episode, i was so curius and excited about how you would do this scene, and oh boy, that NOT DISAPOINTING ME.
You teleport me like a fucking time machine when i was 10 and with my friends we were absolute fans of DBZ.
That Gohan scene make me cry, make me feel really happy, cause the talent and the love exists in the details, i cant belive this show right now, i m just rewatching again, with the hope i forget it completely for feel again that astonishment, the shock.
Thank you very match and sorry for my shitty english.

Thank you very match and sorry for my shitty english.

snippet.textOriginal: You do you. You guys are more than just DBZA anyway. I'll enjoy your content regardless.

snippet.textDisplay:
As someone who’s been watching since the beginning I wanted to thank you guys for the joy you’ve brought to myself and the community for the past 12 years.

Thinking back on it I started watching DBZ in 97 during a Toonami Saiyan saga (ocean dub) marathon, so over half my history watching DBZ has been you guys. And that’s the case for almost all the US fandom, from the Planet Namek/Ultimate DBZ, Ginga Giri Giri old timers to the kids who never heard rock the dragon and may have started with Kai. I preferred the Japanese/subbed version but over time the US dub grew on me. In my mind I associate your teams voices with the characters more than any, and find myself quoting you or thinking back to even the older episodes (if I hear a song called Mahogany I’ll think back to Yama’s desk, or if Barbara Streisand’s “The Way we were” comes on I can’t help but picture snaps joyously slaughtering an Arlian).

As someone whose seen and participated in groups that have been taken down for infringement on Japanese properties (toho related music videos around the same time TFS was founded) I know how frustrating it is to lose your channel repeatedly and your hard work. Thanks for always sticking it out all these years and getting to a really satisfactory conclusion. I agree Buu saga wouldn’t feel right as an epilogue (movie 9 as a curtain call would’ve been one thing but that would have been a massive undertaking). Good luck in all your current in future projects/endeavors and I hope your work on DBZA has opened plenty of doors. You’re as talented as any professional US voice actors I’ve heard and your creativity and dialogue work is unparalleled.

Anyway enough wanking, I’ll see you in another dimension Hfil or machinabridged
snippet.textOriginal:
As someone who’s been watching since the beginning I wanted to thank you guys for the joy you’ve brought to myself and the community for the past 12 years. 

Thinking back on it I started watching DBZ in 97 during a Toonami Saiyan saga (ocean dub) marathon, so over half my history watching DBZ has been you guys. And that’s the case for almost all the US fandom, from the Planet Namek/Ultimate DBZ, Ginga Giri Giri old timers to the kids who never heard rock the dragon and may have started with Kai. I preferred the Japanese/subbed version but over time the US dub grew on me. In my mind I associate your teams voices with the characters more than any, and find myself quoting you or thinking back to even the older episodes (if I hear a song called Mahogany I’ll think back to Yama’s desk, or if Barbara Streisand’s “The Way we were” comes on I can’t help but picture snaps joyously slaughtering an Arlian).

As someone whose seen and participated in groups that have been taken down for infringement on Japanese properties (toho related music videos around the same time TFS was founded) I know how frustrating it is to lose your channel repeatedly and your hard work. Thanks for always sticking it out all these years and getting to a really satisfactory conclusion. I agree Buu saga wouldn’t feel right as an epilogue (movie 9 as a curtain call would’ve been one thing but that would have been a massive undertaking). Good luck in all your current in future projects/endeavors and I hope your work on DBZA has opened plenty of doors. You’re as talented as any professional US voice actors I’ve heard and your creativity and dialogue work is unparalleled. 

Anyway enough wanking,  I’ll see you in another dimension Hfil or machinabridged

snippet.textDisplay:
First of all, thanks for giving people an actual apology. Tons of people and especially companies love giving non-apologies. But you didn't. I can respect that.

Secondly, the big guy has a great attitude when it comes to apologizing. I love how he can't stop himself from making jokes even when things are serious. Didn't expect the other one to start crying though. Kinda funny that he realized himself that it's better to stop saying anything than to continue talking with a sobby voice.
snippet.textOriginal:
First of all, thanks for giving people an actual apology. Tons of people and especially companies love giving non-apologies. But you didn't. I can respect that.

Secondly, the big guy has a great attitude when it comes to apologizing. I love how he can't stop himself from making jokes even when things are serious. Didn't expect the other one to start crying though. Kinda funny that he realized himself that it's better to stop saying anything than to continue talking with a sobby voice.

snippet.textDisplay: i love u guys so much, the whole tfs team, u guys have literally shaped my childhood from when i was like 7 up until now, the effort, blood, sweat, and tears you have put into this series has my undying respect, thank you for you're hard work and dedication to not only a series but ur fans, i am glad u guys are stepping in the right direction and i cant wait to see what else is in store on the teamfourstar channel <333

snippet.textDisplay: You guys were amazing, i have to admit it started a bit late for me, i was a little sprout when it started, (maybe 10 roughly) and I found it in high school, but it was honestly one of the best productions i have ever seen, you guys were amazing and still are, i write poetry in my free time and short stories so i can understand the need to stop when things burn out. I respect you guys as artists for not pushing out some inferior quality production and sticking to yourselves, you guys did it your way and it was the best to my eyes.

I respect you guys as artists for not pushing out some inferior quality production and sticking to yourselves, you guys did it your way and it was the best to my eyes.

snippet.textDisplay: I hate to say it, but whenever they have an "emotional" moment or discussion it never feels like Lanni is sincere. He always just gives me the feeling or sense thst he doesn't care and strikes me as kind of a dick to be honest. He gets angry whenever someone else has the spotlight and i feel like he would be impossible to work well with.
snippet.textOriginal: I hate to say it, but whenever they have an "emotional" moment or discussion it never feels like Lanni is sincere. snippet.textDisplay: Ill admit, DBZA is what brought me here and what kept me here for a long time. Now that its gone im not sure how much of your content ill watch but i will stay subscribed just for your DBcember videos. It may sound silly to some but its actually your DBcember videos that make me feel like its the holiday season. Otherwise it would just feel like another month to me. Regardless though you have my support and subscription for as long as you guys have the channel. Thanks for the years.

snippet.textDisplay: Unbelievable that it’s really been 12 years. I still remember when my mate showed me the first episode in Geography class. I fell in love with the Nappa character “Vegeta... I can fly!” Well done guys, you should be so proud of what you have created for over a decade :)

snippet.textDisplay: Guys, while this is certainly disappointing, I completely understand your reasoning. I always figured it would end one day anyway so this isn’t so much a shock as an expected inevitability. I’m glad that it’s at least ended on a high note and I’ll happily rewatch the series whenever I need a good laugh. Love you guys, I look forward to whatever you do in the future.
snippet.textOriginal: Guys, while this is certainly disappointing, I completely understand your reasoning. snippet.textDisplay: I’ll enjoy every single episode of DBZA, I like I can watch them all now.   This is the right call.   Also, I think writing for the Buu Saga would be much harder as buu wasn’t really a charismatic villain as cell and Frieza.   I mean there is majin vegeta and and fusions but....those are highlights for me.   If that makes sense.

snippet.textDisplay:
I never was fan of dbz.
I just don’t know how to start it.
Thx to you all, I start my journey from DBZA.

Now I already finished DB, fall in love in DBZ Fighter and currently watch Boo-saga.

Thank you to all. You ignited the fire in me.
And your decision is pretty mature.
Thanks you, guys.

snippet.textDisplay:
This really doesn’t make me upset considering how I always thought of the cell saga to be the way DBZ was supposed to end! You did it justice and probably even did better than the original material.

Thank you guys so much for such a wild ride, I’ve enjoyed watching this series since I was just a little kid. Y’all continued to show me that despite its many flaws, DBZ has every right to be my favorite series of all time and y’all really nailed it when it came to paying tribute to it. I wish you all the best of luck in your future endeavors and I cannot wait time see what y’all have in store for us next!
snippet.textOriginal:

Y’all continued to show me that despite its many flaws, DBZ has every right to be my favorite series of all time and y’all really nailed it when it came to paying tribute to it. I wish you all the best of luck in your future endeavors and I cannot wait time see what y’all have in store for us next!
